thread.title: Water rescue at Panmure Bridge, Auckland
thread.title_full: Water rescue at Panmure Bridge, Auckland

title: Water rescue at Panmure Bridge, Auckland
text:
Water rescue at Panmure Bridge, Auckland Last updated 11:35, February 21 2017 1 NEWS 
The collapse at the old Panmure Bridge left four people in the water. 
A person was trapped against the Panmure Bridge in Auckland after scaffolding collapsed throwing up to seven people into the water on Tuesday. 
Fire Service shift manager Carlos Dempsey said it was unclear how many people had been in the water, but emergency services has rescued three from the water after the incident at 10am. 
One person had been trapped in the scaffolding and needed to be rescued by the fire service's high angle rescue team. CAT OWEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
A view of the collapsed scaffolding on Panmure Bridge. 
They had used a turntable ladder appliance to reach the man, he said. 
Witnesses told 1News the scaffolding collapse sounded "like a plane was landing". 
St John spokesman Mark Deoki said one patient in a moderate condition and two patients with minor injuries were taken to Middlemore Hospital. CAT OWEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
Collapsed scaffolding in the lagoon beneath Panmure Bridge. 
Another patient was being assessed at A&E. 
Two ambulances and a specialist response team attended the collapse and a number of bystanders helped with the rescue effort. It was hard to determine exactly how the scaffolding collapsed, he said. 
The bridge remained open to traffic. CAT OWEN/FAIRFAX NZ
